intro: Coelodiscus coudercii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are heart-shaped and glossy, while its flowers come in a variety of colors including purple, pink, and white. Coelodiscus coudercii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
